item.title: Hazelbourne Road Complaint, 4th December
item.description:
Again - the cleaning on Hazelbourne Road is clearly lacking, insufficient and just not being carried out effectively or professionally enough The photo of the discarded black bag of domestic rubbish is outside number 24. This was reported way over a week ago and is still there. The large plastic box was reported as a flytip well over a week ago and is still to be collected And thereâ€™s now a further flytip on Westfield terrace.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hazelbourne Road, Clapham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree root issues, 4th December
item.description:
Resident has called to report the tree located on the highway outside 48 Glanfield road is causing issues where the root is growing through the water pipes. Previous owner has had Thames water attend the address but resident concerned this is going to be a problem going forward. Please can this be looked into.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Glanfield Road, Upper Elmers End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: DEAD FOX IN THE ROAD O/S No 25, 4th December
item.description:
Resident reporting there is dead fox in the road o/s No 25 there is a school at the top of the road, please could someone look into getting this removed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Edendale Road, Barnehurst, Greater London

item.title: Lime Bikes & Forest Bikes scattered across the pavement, 4th December
item.description:
Circa 10 bikes blocking the footpath outside the Old Royal Naval College. The footpath is dangerous because of circa 10 lime / Forest bikes carelessly scattered across the ground. This not only represents a clear hazard to pedestrians, mobility-challenged, frail and elderly, it is also adversely affects the visual amenity of the Maritime Greenwich World Heritage Site.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): College Way, East Greenwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog Fouling outside 16 Hawthorne Crescent for 10 days, 4th December
item.description:
The dog fouling has been there now for nearly two weeks. It is just outside our master bedroom window. A pregnant person is staying in the house and we are concerned about the impact on air quality .

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Hawthorne Crescent, Greenwich
